content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks in the markdown document using regular expressions
    pattern = r"```([\s\S]+?)`"`"
    matches = findall(pattern, md)

    # Extract the content of each code block and remove code fences
    code_blocks = [match[1] for match in matches]
    cleaned_code_blocks = [replace(strip(block), "```", "") for block in code_blocks]

    # Join the cleaned code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code_blocks = join(cleaned_code_blocks, "\n")

    return joined_code_blocks
end
```
